diff_hunk:
@@ -30,6 +34,11 @@ def _worker_loop(dataset, index_queue, data_queue, collate_fn):
     global _use_shared_memory
     _use_shared_memory = True
 
+    # Intialize C side signal handlers because Python signal handler on things
+    # like SIGBUS and SIGSEGV will still be executed in C and likely cause error
+    # again.
body: I don't think this message is correct. Python signal handlers will cause the error again exactly because the handling will be done on the Python side and not on the C side (the C side only registers that the signal happened and returns)
body_html: I don't think this message is correct. Python signal handlers will cause the error again exactly because the handling will be done on the Python side and not on the C side (the C side only registers that the signal happened and returns)
body_text: I don't think this message is correct. Python signal handlers will cause the error again exactly because the handling will be done on the Python side and not on the C side (the C side only registers that the signal happened and returns)
